self.title: self
self.description: This holds the key (UUID, MMSI or URL) of this vessel, the actual data is in the vessels array.

vessels.title: vessels
vessels.description: A wrapper object for vessel objects, each describing vessels in range, including this vessel.

vessels.*.title: (^urn:mrn:(imo|signalk):(mmsi:[2-7][0-9]{8,8}|uuid:[0-9A-Fa-f]{8}-[0-9A-Fa-f]{4}-4[0-9A-Fa-f]{3}-[89ABab][0-9A-Fa-f]{3}-[0-9A-Fa-f]{12}))|^(http(s?):.*|mailto:.*|tel:(\+?)[0-9]{4,})$
vessels.*.subtitle: vessel
vessels.*.description: An object describing an individual vessel. It should be an object in vessels, named using MMSI or a UUID

vessels.*.url.title: url
vessels.*.url.description: A location of a resource, potentially relative. For hierarchical schemes (like http), applications must resolve relative URIs (e.g. './v1/api/'). Implementations should support the following schemes: http:, https:, mailto:, tel:, and ws:.

vessels.*.mmsi.title: mmsi
vessels.*.mmsi.description: Maritime Mobile Service Identity (MMSI). Has to be 9 digits. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maritime_Mobile_Service_Identity for information.

vessels.*.uuid.title: uuid
vessels.*.uuid.description: A unique Signal K flavoured maritime resource identifier (MRN). A MRN is a form of URN, following a specific format: urn:mrn:<issueing authority>:<id type>:<id>. In case of a Signal K uuid, that looks like this: urn:mrn:signalk:uuid:<uuid>, where Signal K is the issuing authority and UUID (v4) the ID type.

vessels.*.name.title: name
vessels.*.name.description: The common name of the vessel

vessels.*.flag.title: flag
vessels.*.flag.description: The country of ship registration, or flag state of the vessel

vessels.*.port.title: port
vessels.*.port.description: The home port of the vessel

vessels.*.registrations.title: registrations
vessels.*.registrations.description: The various registrations of the vessel.
vessels.*.registrations.example: eg for a New Zealand Part B recreational vessel: 'NZ654'

vessels.*.registrations.imo.title: imo
vessels.*.registrations.imo.description: The IMO number of the vessel.

vessels.*.registrations.national.title: national
vessels.*.registrations.national.description: The national registration number of the vessel.

vessels.*.registrations.national.*.title: (^[A-Za-z0-9_-]+$)
vessels.*.registrations.national.*.description: This regex pattern is used for validating the identifier for the registration

vessels.*.registrations.national.*.descr.title: description
vessels.*.registrations.national.*.descr.example: New Zealand Part B recreational vessel

vessels.*.registrations.local.title: local
vessels.*.registrations.local.description: A local or state registration number of the vessel.

vessels.*.registrations.local.*.title: (^[A-Za-z0-9_-]+$)
vessels.*.registrations.local.*.description: This regex pattern is used for validating the identifier for the registration

vessels.*.registrations.other.title: other
vessels.*.registrations.other.description: Other registration or permits for the vessel.

vessels.*.registrations.other.*.title: (^[A-Za-z0-9_-]+$)
vessels.*.registrations.other.*.description: This regex pattern is used for validating the identifier for the registration

vessels.*.communication.title: communication
vessels.*.communication.subtitle: communication
vessels.*.communication.description: Schema describing the communication child-object of a Vessel.

vessels.*.communication.emailHf.title: emailHf
vessels.*.communication.emailHf.description: Email address to be used for HF email (Winmail, Airmail, Sailmail)

vessels.*.communication.skipperName.title: skipperName
vessels.*.communication.skipperName.description: Full name of the skipper of the vessel.

vessels.*.communication.crewNames.title: crewNames
vessels.*.communication.crewNames.description: Array with the names of the crew

vessels.*.environment.title: environment
vessels.*.environment.subtitle: environment
vessels.*.environment.description: Schema describing the environmental child-object of a Vessel.

vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.title: timestamp
vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.description: ISO-8601 (UTC) string representing date and time.

vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.title: $source
vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.description: Reference to the source under vessel's sources. A dot spearated path to the data. eg [type].[bus].[device]

vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.title: _attr
vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.subtitle: _attr schema.
vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.description: Filesystem specific data, e.g. security, possibly more later.

vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.title: _mode
vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.subtitle: _mode schema.
vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.description: Unix style permissions, often written in `owner:group:other` form, `-rw-r--r--`

vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.title: meta
vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.subtitle: Meta schema.
vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.description: Provides meta data to enable alarm and display configuration.

vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.title: displayName

vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.description: A display name for this value.

vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.description: A long name for this value.

vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.description: The (derived) SI unit of this value.

vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.title: timeout
vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.subtitle: Timeout
vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.description: The timeout in (fractional) seconds after which this data is invalid.

vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.title: alertMethod
vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.subtitle: Alert Method
vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.description: The method to use to raise the alert. An alert is an event that should be known

vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.title: warnMethod
vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.subtitle: Warn Method
vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.description: The method to use to raise the warning. A warning is an unexpected event that may require attention

vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.subtitle: Alarm Method
vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.description: The method to use to raise the alarm. An alarm requires immediate attention, eg no oil pressure

vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.title: emergencyMethod
vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.subtitle: Emergency Method
vessels.*.environment.outside.temperatur.description: The method to use to raise an emergency. An emergency is an immediate danger to life or vessel

resources.waypoints.*.position.$source.description: Reference to the source under vessel's sources. A dot spearated path to the data. eg [type].[bus].[device]

resources.waypoints.*.position._attr.title: _attr
resources.waypoints.*.position._attr.subtitle: _attr schema.
resources.waypoints.*.position._attr.description: Filesystem specific data, e.g. security, possibly more later.

resources.waypoints.*.position._attr._mo.subtitle: _mode schema.
resources.waypoints.*.position._attr._mo.description: Unix style permissions, often written in `owner:group:other` form, `-rw-r--r--`

resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.title: meta
resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.subtitle: Meta schema.
resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.description: Provides meta data to enable alarm and display configuration.

resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.disp.title: displayName
resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.disp.subtitle: DisplayName schema.
resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.disp.description: A display name for this value.

resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.long.subtitle: LongName schema.
resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.long.description: A long name for this value.

resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.shor.subtitle: ShortName schema.
resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.shor.description: A short name for this value.

resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.gaug.subtitle: gaugeType schema.
resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.gaug.description: The type of gauge necessary to display this value.

resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.unit.title: units

resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.time.subtitle: Timeout
resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.time.description: The timeout in (fractional) seconds after which this data is invalid.

resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.aler.title: alertMethod
resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.aler.subtitle: Alert Method
resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.aler.description: The method to use to raise the alert. An alert is an event that should be known

resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.warn.title: warnMethod
resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.warn.subtitle: Warn Method
resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.warn.description: The method to use to raise the warning. A warning is an unexpected event that may require attention

resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.alar.title: alarmMethod
resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.alar.subtitle: Alarm Method
resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.alar.description: The method to use to raise the alarm. An alarm requires immediate attention, eg no oil pressure

resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.emer.title: emergencyMethod
resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.emer.subtitle: Emergency Method
resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.emer.description: The method to use to raise an emergency. An emergency is an immediate danger to life or vessel

resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.zone.title: zones
resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.zone.subtitle: Zones schema.
resources.waypoints.*.position.meta.zone.description: The zones defining the range of values for this signalk value.

resources.waypoints.*.feature.geometry.c.title: coordinates
resources.waypoints.*.feature.geometry.c.description: A single position, in x,y order (Lon, Lat)
